quote: I hate organized religion. I hate that people use it to justify their crappy, bigoted beliefs.
author: Hannah Harrington,  Saving June

quote: Somewhere along the line, organized religion stopped being about faith, and started being about who had the power to keep the faith. You said that the purpose of religion was to bring people together. But does it, really? Or does it-knowingly, purposefully, and intentionally--break them apart?
author: Jodi Picoult,  Change of Heart

quote: I have no argument with those who see in organized religion a template or an imperative to live life according to a prescribed set of beliefs. Just give others the room, within the laws of civil society, to believe or not believe whatever they like.
author: Michael J. Fox,  Always Looking Up: The Adventures of an Incurable Optimist

quote: religion, the most powerful of the elements which have entered into the formation of moral feeling, having almost always been governed either by the ambition of a hierarchy, seeking control over every department of human conduct, or by the spirit of Puritanism.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: . . . in no instance has a system in regard to religion been ever established, but for the purpose, as well as with the effect of its being made an instrument of intimidation, corruption, and delusion, for the support of depredation and oppression in the hands of governments.
author: Jeremy Bentham,  Constitutional Code; For the Use All Nations and All Governments Professing Liberal Opinions Volume 1

quote: Religion is more than rite and ritual.
author: Yann Martel,  Life of Pi

quote: Almost any sect, cult, or religion will legislate its creed into law if it acquires the political power to do so.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Religion is about turning untested belief into unshakable truth through the power of institutions and the passage of time.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: A sect or party is an elegant incognito devised to save a man from the vexation of thinking.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: I think religion is a neurological disorder.
author: Bill Maher

quote: The religionist is a living fossil, embedded in that rock called faith.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: Religion is a complex and often contradictory force in our world. It fosters hope and comfort but also doubt and guilt. It creates both community and exclusion. It brings societies together around shared belief and tears them apart through war. However, what unites the faithful, whatever their religion, is the unshakeable force of generosity.
author: Laura Arrillaga-Andreessen

quote: I had retained little of what is generally called religion, except for a visceral conviction that our lives are controlled by some universal mechanism that is greater than ourselves. Perhaps that was what others called God. Perhaps not.
author: Michael Cox,  The Meaning of Night

quote: Regardless of what I think about Islam or Wicca or any other religion, the fact is that it's a group of people. Every faith has its ceremonies. And since it's made up of people, every faith also has its assholes.
author: Jim Butcher,  White Night

quote: One possibility is: God is nothing but the power of the universe to organize itself.
author: Lee Smolin

quote: Religion's just a well-oiled profit-driven denial of the randomness of it all.
author: Wally Lamb

quote: Religious structure often dilutes the spiritual experience.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Life, the Truth, and Being Free

quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Will Durant,  The Story of Philosophy

quote: Atheism, a religion dedicated to its own sense of smug superiority.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: For great men, religion is a way of making friends; small people make religion a fighting tool.
author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam,  Ignited Minds: Unleashing the Power Within India

quote: I think it [religion] is an art, the greatest one; an extension of the communion all the other arts attempt.
author: Dodie Smith,  I Capture the Castle

quote: When you see a man with a great deal of religion displayed in his shop window, you may depend upon it he keeps a very small stock of it within.
author: Charles Haddon Spurgeon

quote: A cult is a religion with no political power.
author: Tom Wolfe

quote: Religion is like a pair of shoes.....Find one that fits for you, but don't make me wear your shoes.
author: George Carlin

quote: Religion is the masterpiece of the art of animal training, for it trains people as to how they shall think.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The philosophic outlook rises above all sectarian controversy. It finds its own position not only by appreciating and synthesizing what is solidly based in the rival sects but also by capping them all with the keystone of nonduality.
author: Paul Brunton,  The Notebooks of Paul Brunton

quote: All religion, my friend, is simply evolved out of fraud, fear, greed, imagination, and poetry.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: With or without religion, you would have good people doing good things and evil people doing evil things. But for good people to do evil things, that takes religion.
author: Steven Weinberg

quote: Theological formation is the gradual and often painful discovery of God's incomprehensibility. You can be competent in many things, but you cannot be competent in God.
author: Henri J.M. Nouwen

quote: Beliefs are not related to religion but they are basically about who you are.
author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free

quote: Every time you understand something, religion becomes less likely. Only with the discovery of the double helix and the ensuing genetic revolution have we had grounds for thinking that the powers held traditionally to be the exclusive property of the gods might one day be ours. . . .
author: James D. Watson

quote: Religion, n. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: Yes, reason has been a part of organized religion, ever since two nudists took dietary advice from a talking snake.
author: Jon Stewart

quote: Just in terms of allocation of time resources, religion is not very efficient. There`s a lot more I could be doing on a Sunday morning.
author: Bill Gates

quote: Religion is like language or dress. We gravitate toward the practices with which we were raised. In the end, though, we are all proclaiming the same thing. That life has meaning. That we are grateful for the power that created us.
author: Dan Brown,  Angels & Demons

quote: A religion that takes no account of practical affairs and does not help to solve them is no religion.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Culture is the arts elevated to a set of beliefs.
author: Thomas Wolfe

quote: There is only one religion - it is a way a man dies.
author: James Runcie,  The Colour Of Heaven

quote: The only interesting thing about religion is how many people it's slaughtered. Communism and Nazism are religions as well, make no mistake about it.
author: Lemmy Kilmister

quote: God has no religion.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: There was a time when religion ruled the world. It is known as the Dark Ages.
author: Ruth Hurmence Green

quote: No religion is perfect, not after man gets through with it.
author: Christopher Pike,  The Red Dice

quote: Religious moderation is the product of secular knowledge and scriptural ignorance.
author: Sam Harris,  The End of Faith: Religion, Terror, and the Future of Reason

quote: Beware the religion that turns you against another one. It's unlikely that it's really religion at all.
author: Joan D. Chittister,  God Speaks in Many Tongues: Meditate with Joan Chittister

quote: All religions are based on obsolete terminology.
author: Vladimir Nabokov,  Pale Fire

quote: Yoga is not a religion. It is a science, science of well-being, science of youthfulness, science of integrating body, mind and soul.
author: Amit Ray,  Yoga and Vipassana: An Integrated Life Style

quote: This is my simple religion. There is no need for temples; no need for complicated philosophy. Our own brain, our own heart is our temple; the philosophy is kindness.
author: Dalai Lama XIV,  The Dalai Lama: A Policy of Kindness: An Anthology of Writings By and About the Dalai Lama

quote: One's own religion is after all a matter between oneself and one's Maker and no one else's.
author: Kahlil Gibran

quote: New scientific ideas never spring from a communal body, however organized, but rather from the head of an individually inspired researcher who struggles with his problems in lonely thought and unites all his thought on one single point which is his whole world for the moment.
author: Max Planck
